title: Former Minister Anura Priyadarshana Yapa arrested
byline: Former Minister Anura Priyadarshana Yapa was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) for allegedly misappropriating Rs. 6.1 million in flood relief aid in 2014, the Police Media Spokesperson said.

title: Suspect from Kandy arrested over Ella Odyssey e-ticket mafia
byline: A 37-year-old person from Kandy allegedly involved in a racket of selling train tickets to foreigners at exorbitant prices has been arrested yesterday, police said.

title: Confusion over data on paddy harvest in 2024: Trade Minister
byline: There is a confusion with regard to data pertaining to the paddy harvest in 2024, Minister of Trade Wasantha Samarasinghe told Parliament today.

title: Thousands evacuated as new fast-growing fire ignites near Los Angeles
byline: A new fast-moving wildfire has erupted in Los Angeles County, prompting tens of thousands to evacuate a region already reeling from the most destructive fires in its history.

title: Labour official arrested over Rs. 250,000 bribe
byline: A Labour Department official has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery and Corruption for accepting a bribe of Rs. 250,000.

title: Thailand legalises same-sex marriage
byline: Hundreds of same-sex couples are tying the knot across Thailand on Thursday as the country becomes the first in Southeast Asia to recognize marriage equality.

title: Moderate air quality reported in most cities
byline: A moderate level of air quality was reported in most cities across the country, according to the Sri Lanka Air Quality Index (SL AQI).

title: Trump shuts off access to asylum, plans to send 10,000 troops to border
byline: Trump administration officials are considering deploying as many as 10,000 soldiers to the U.S.-Mexico border and using Department of Defense bases to hold migrants awaiting deportation as they plan their dramatic crackdown on illegal immigration, according to an internal government memo obtained by CBS News.

title: Fitch upgrades ratings of 10 Sri Lankan banks
byline: Fitch Ratings has upgraded the National Long-Term Ratings of 10 Sri Lankan banks, following the recent sovereign upgrade and recalibration of the agency’s Sri Lankan national rating scale.

title: CSE targets 20 IPOs in 2025
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) is targeting 20 initial public offerings (IPOs) this year, with the IPOs with five to six already in the pipeline, according to its Chairman Dilshan Wirasekara.

title: Attracting private sector investments critical for Sri Lanka’s continued growth: World Bank
byline: Sri Lanka must focus on attracting more private sector investment to maintain its hard-earned macroeconomic stability and continued recovery, according to the World Bank.

title: T-bill yields take a toll with sharp declines
byline: Yesterday’s treasury bill (T-bill) auction saw a sharp decline in rates across the board.

title: Turnover crosses LKR 10 Bn
byline: Indices closed in green as a result of price gains in counters such as Hatton National Bank voting & nonvoting and National Development Bank with the turnover crossing Rs. 10.6 Bn.

title: Cost reflective price for MPs’ meals; Day’s meals might cost Rs. 3,000: Bimal
byline: Parliament is to introduce a cost reflective price for MPs’ meals soon, where meals including breakfast, lunch and evening tea might cost Rs. 3,000, Leader of the House Bimal Ratnayke announced today.

title: Election expenses probe launched on MP Archchuna, eight other candidates in Jaffna
byline: Jaffna police have initiated investigations into election expenses of nine candidates, including Jaffna District MP Ramanathan Archchuna, who contested the last general elections.

title: Anura Yapa’s arrest: Small fish netted, big sharks roam free: Champika Ranawaka
byline: Referring to the arrest of former MP and Minister Anura Priyadarshana Yapa and his spouse, United Republican Front (URF) leader Patali Champika Ranawaka said though the government is expected to arrest fraudster Arjuna Mahendran, those responsible for the economic crisis and the e-Visa scam, it had embarked on a political witch-hunt.

title: Anura Priyadarshana Yapa, wife and two others released on bail
byline: Four suspects including former Minister Anura Priyadarshana Yapa and his wife arrested for allegedly misappropriating Rs.6.1 million in flood relief aid in 2014 were granted bail after being produced before Colombo Additional Magistrate.

title: Police probe unprofessional behaviour of officers in viral video
byline: Police have launched an investigation into a viral social media video showing a group of officers in uniform, allegedly under the influence of liquor, sleeping in an unruly manner at a location.

title: MPs’ daily meal charges increased to Rs. 2,000
byline: The charges for Memners’ of Parliament is to be increased to Rs. 2,000 as per a decision by the Parliamentary House-Keeping Committe today, committee member Gamagedara Dissanayake said.

title: Minister mistakenly sits on seat allocated to Leader of the House
byline: Minister Ananda Wijepala mistakenly sat on the seat allocated to the Leader of the House in Parliament today.

title: Travis Head - Prabath Jayasuriya key battle
byline: Sri Lanka will host Australia in a two-match Test series which gets underway next week at Galle. Sri Lankan fans have traditionally loved playing against the Aussies who have always been one of the best teams in the world although results have often favoured the visiting team.

title: Smoking declines among men but rises among women, raising cancer risks: Specialists
byline: The smoking rates have dropped among men but are rising in women, increasing the risks of cancer among young female smokers, pediatric respiratory disease specialist Dr. Chana de Silva warned.

title: No vehicles provided to government MPs: PM
byline: The government has not provided vehicles to any ruling party MP except for visually impared MP Sugath Wasantha De Silva, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya said today.

title: Education Minister addresses schoolgirls’ hygiene issues
byline: Prime Minister and Education Minister, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, held a meeting to discussed the hygiene challenges faced by female students above Grade 6 in schools around the country.

title: Police release CCTV of suspected gunman in Kandana shooting
byline: Police have released CCTV footage and photographs of a suspected gunman wanted in connection with a shooting at the residence of Ranjith Kumara, also known as ‘Kandane Konda Ranji,’ in December last year.

title: Two NPP MPs using luxury vehicles: Opposition MP
byline: Two ruling party MPs are using luxury vehicles despite assurances by the government that such facilities will not be allowed, Opposition MP Chamara Samapth Dassanayake alleged in Parliament today.

title: Trump tells Putin to end ’ridiculous war’ in Ukraine or face new sanctions
byline: Donald Trump has warned he will impose high tariffs and further sanctions on Russia if Vladimir Putin fails to end the war in Ukraine.

title: Proposal to standardise marriage age in Sri Lanka
byline: President of the Women Parliamentarians’ Forum, Saroja Savithri said there is a need to prepare amendments to establish a uniform age limit for marriage under the various marriage laws currently in force in Sri Lanka.

title: Govt. aims to develop primary healthcare; pilot projects in two districts this year: Nalinda
byline: The Health Ministry will give utmost priority to developing primary healthcare in the country this year where pilot projects will initiate in two districts in 2025, Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Thousands evacuated as new fast-growing fire ignites near Los Angeles
byline: A new fast-moving wildfire has erupted in Los Angeles County, prompting tens of thousands to evacuate a region already reeling from the most destructive fires in its history.

title: Govt looks to India in Trincomalee, turns to China in Hambantota in oil refinery push
byline: Hot on the heels of signing an agreement with China’s Sinopec for an oil refinery in Hambantota, the government is planning to establish a similar facility in Trincomalee with the help of India if willing, a Minister said yesterday.

title: India investigates 17 ’mysterious’ deaths in same village
byline: Officials are investigating the ’’mysterious’’ deaths of 17 people - most of them children - in the same village in Indian-administered Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Trump’s plan to end US birthright citizenship faces first court challenge
byline: A Seattle judge will hear a request on Thursday by four states to temporarily halt President Donald Trump’s executive order to end birthright citizenship in the US.

title: Sweeping changes to education system from 2026: Prime Minister
byline: Sweeping changes will be introduced to the education system in 2026 under which a module system will be introduced instead of textbooks while  there will be less classroom work, Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya told Parliament today.

title: Public debate on Ministerial perks on the cards?
byline: A challenge posed by SLPP MP D.V. Chanaka for a public debate on perks given to Ministers and Deputy Ministers was accepted by Minister Ananda Wijepala in Parliament today, thus indicating that such an eventuality would be on the cards during the coming days.

title: Grade five Scholarship Exam results released
byline: The 2024 grade five scholarship examination results have been released a short while ago, Commissioner General of Examinations H.J.M.C. Amith Jayasundara said.

title: Explain why Jaffna Cultural Hall name was changed: Douglas Devananda
byline: Former Minister Douglas Devananda expressed his shock and dismay over the recent name change of the Cultural Hall located in Jaffna.
